title: Prohibits refusal to issue or renew certain insurance policies solely on the ground of the nature of the occupation of the applicant
summary: Provides that no insurer shall refuse to issue or renew a covered policy of property/casualty insurance or include a provision therein limiting coverage solely on the ground of the nature of the occupation of the applicant or insured; applies to personal lines insurance including personal umbrella policies as well as automobile liability policies.

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to prohibited  basis  for
         refusal to issue or renew a covered policy of property/casualty insur-
         ance or for limiting coverage therein

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 3425 of the insurance law is amended  by  adding  a
    2  new subsection (i-1) to read as follows:
    3    (I-1)  NO  INSURER SHALL REFUSE TO ISSUE OR RENEW A COVERED POLICY, OR
    4  INCLUDE A PROVISION IN THE INSURANCE CONTRACT  LIMITING  COVERAGE  UNDER
    5  THE  CONTRACT,  SOLELY  ON THE GROUND OF THE NATURE OF THE OCCUPATION OF
    6  THE APPLICANT OR INSURED.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first  of  the  calendar  month
    8  next succeeding the thirtieth day after it shall have become a law.
